greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of lone-child-avoiding rooted trees with n leaves of exactly k colors.
comment: Lone-child-avoiding rooted trees are also called planted series-reduced trees in some other sequences.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 50 rows)
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} k * T(n,k) = A326396(n). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 11 2019
example: The 12 trees counted by row n = 3:
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
add(binomial(A(i, k)+j-1, j)*b(n-i*j, i-1, k), j=0..n/i)))
T:= (n, k)-> add(A(n, k-j)*(-1)^j*binomial(k, j), j=0..k-1):
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 18 2018
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[Binomial[A[i, k] + j - 1, j] b[n - i j, i - 1, k], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^(k - i)*Binomial[k, i]*A[n, i], {i, 1, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 24 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) \\ here R(n,k) is k-th column of A319254.
R(n, k)={my(v=[k]); for(n=2, n, v=concat(v, EulerT(concat(v, [0]))[n])); v}
M(n)={my(v=vector(n, k, R(n,k)~)); Mat(vector(n, k, sum(i=1, k, (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k,i)*v[i])))}
xref: The unlabeled version, counting inequivalent leaf-colorings of lone-child-avoiding rooted trees, is A330465.
Lone-child-avoiding rooted trees are counted by A001678 (shifted left once).
Labeled lone-child-avoiding rooted trees are counted by A060356.
Matula-Goebel numbers of lone-child-avoiding rooted trees are A291636.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 17 2018
